intro: Asarca alaris, commonly known as the slender lousewort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Asarca alaris is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves.
